results:
Based on the search results, I found some information about Polish editions of "The Great Gatsby" (Wielki Gatsby):

## Polish Editions of "Wielki Gatsby"

The book was first published in Poland in 1965 by Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy (PIW) with a translation by Ariadna Demkowska-Bohdziewicz.

PIW (Państwowy Instytut Wydawniczy) is a Polish publishing house founded in 1946 in Warsaw, and until 1989, PIW was one of the three most important Polish publishers of fiction, alongside Spółdzielnia Wydawnicza "Czytelnik" and Wydawnictwo Literackie.

The search results also mention that various publishers have released editions of the book, including: Rebis, Świat Książki, Penguin Books, and Dom Wydawniczy Rebis.

However, the search results don't provide a comprehensive history of all Polish editions by different publishers like Czytelnik, Rebis, and Prószyński. The information is limited to confirming that PIW published the first Polish edition in 1965 and that other publishers like Rebis have also released editions of the book.

F. Scott Fitzgerald's most famous novel continues to fascinate readers and has been adapted to film multiple times (1926, 1949, 1974, 2000, and 2013).
